alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued October 06 at 1:22PM MST until October 06 at 2:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Southwestern Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... * Until 230 PM MST. * At 122 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 8 miles south of Ligurta to 12 miles south of Fortuna Foothills, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes AZ Route 195 between mile markers 10 and 25. Locations impacted include... Yuma. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
